Title.evidence: The double-blind, randomized, placebo-controlled phase 3 study of orally administered PLX3397

Trial_Design.evidence: ENLIVEN was a phase 3 randomized, placebo-controlled clinical trial

Participants.evidence: adults with TGCT not amenable to improvement with surgery received pexidartinib or placebo for 24 weeks

Intervention.evidence: received pexidartinib or placebo for 24 weeks

Objective.evidence: What level of pain relief was achieved by pexidartinib treatment in ENLIVEN?

Method_Outcome.evidence: primary definition of a pain response was a decrease of at least 30% in the weekly mean worst-pain NRS score and increase of less than 30% in narcotic analgesic use between baseline and week 25

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: 121 were randomized (50% [60] to placebo, 50% [61] to pexidartinib)

Blinding.evidence: The double-blind, randomized, placebo-controlled phase 3 study

Number_Randomised.evidence: 121 were randomized (50% [60] to placebo, 50% [61] to pexidartinib)

Number_Analysed.evidence: 120 were given either placebo or pexidartinib (59 received placebo and 61 received pexidartinib) and were included in an intent-to-treat analysis

Result_Outcome.evidence: response percentage 31% [19 of 61] [95% CI 21% to 44%] versus 15% [9 of 59] [95% CI 8% to 27%]; one-sided p = 0.03
